definition: to beat/to flog/to examine under torture
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father
to beat a prisoner (to obtain confessions)/to give sb the third degree/to torture
variant of 繃扒吊拷|绷扒吊拷[beng4 ba1 diao4 kao3]
to strip, tie up, hang and beat sb, an ancient torture technique

sentences.english: We then got to view statues of the 18 levels of Hell and the torture methods used within.
sentences.chinese: 我們還參觀了十八層地獄和陰天子的嚴拷方式。

sentences.english: Investigators could tell that it had been built using professional tools.
sentences.chinese: 專家認爲這是使用專業工具拷上去的。

sentences.english: The soldiers handcuff the ring leader and cover his head.
sentences.chinese: 士兵們拷上了團伙的頭目並蓋住他的頭。

sentences.english: Jeff cuffed him to a table and we opened the door that led to the basement.
sentences.chinese: 傑夫用手銬把他拷桌子上，我們打開通向地下室的門。

sentences.english: Once a good friend actually chained him to the pipes of an electric radiator!
sentences.chinese: 一次，一個好朋友甚至把他拷在暖氣管上。

sentences.english: You can't copy your file with this disc; it's full.
sentences.chinese: 你不能用這張磁盤拷文件，這張盤滿了。

definition: to collapse/variant of 斃|毙[bi4]/variant of 獙[bi4]
to bind a person's upper body, with arms tied behind the back and rope looped around the neck/to truss up
cangue (wooden collar like stocks used to restrain and punish criminals in China)
to do a body search/to frisk
